reviews.text: A wonderful attraction and great day out. Went with all the family along with 4 month old baby and he equally loved the experience. The staff are very welcoming and helpful. The steam trains very impressive and restored to a great specification making the journey very comfortable and nostalgic. Amazing scenic views on the way and the trip to the engine house was throughly enjoyed by the children especially

One of the UK’s premier tourist attractions. The line passes through stunning scenery and has stations at charming market towns. There are fantastic countryside walks between stations. Locomotives and carriages are maintained in pristine order. I cannot recommend visiting enough! 🚂

The place and facilities are stunning, can't fault them. Unfortunately the prices are becoming prohibitively expensive. 2 adults and 3 children return rather startling. I appreciate they have overheads and future projects they wish to carry out,, but where once we would visit several times a year, now its only once. And from speaking to friends, they feel the seem.

What a lovely little steam railway.  Experience of a steam train is different so if you have been on one or fancy a little bit of nostalgic taste in life.  Worth a visit.  The station is really nice too. Nice day out. If you can get in a private carriage do so.  Makes the experience.

Nice place to have a drink and marvel at the gritty engineering undertaken to produce these locomotives. There's also a really friendly and knowledgeable man who can talk through the locomotive awaiting restoration which is currently parked up on one of the disused platforms.
